channel.title: Blog on Universal
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Universal

item.title: Academic SEMINAR
item.description: Professor Mengmeng Guo from the School of Finance at Nanjing Agricultural University was invited to give an academic speech titled “Flooded Venture: Extreme Rainfall and Entrepreneurship” in HKUST(GZ) and attend our team meeting.

item.title: Xiangzhang economic academic seminar
item.description: Phd student Jiao Xiong attended the Xiangzhang economic academic seminar and made an academic report titled “Technological change from fossil-fuel to renewable: Evidence from offshore energy”.

item.title: Xiangzhang economic academic seminar
item.description: Prof. Yangsiyu Lu attended the 2024 Greater Bay Area Science Forum——Green Energy Industry Science and Technology Innovation Sub-Forum and conducted a research on offshore wind power in Yangjiang City.

item.title: CNCC Green Bag
item.description: PhD student Jiao Xiong participated in CNCC Green Bag and gave an academic report titled “Technological change from fossil-fuel to renewable: Evidence from offshore energy”.

item.title: Academic Visiting
item.description: Prof. Yangsiyu Lu was invited to serve as a judge for the social science track of the 2nd World AI4S Prize.

item.title: Energy Transition and Climate Finance
item.description: Professor Lu was invited to attend the seminar on “Sustainable Future: Energy Transition and Climate Finance” and give an academic report.

item.title: Tianjin University Economics doctoral Academic Forum
item.description: PhD student Zhenhuan Yang was invited to attend the 6th Tianjin University Economics Doctoral Academic Forum and make an academic report titled:Raining on Bonds: The Financing Costs of Extreme Rain on Urban Investment Bonds.

item.title: International Society for Energy Transition Studies (ISETS)
item.description:
Lu Yangsiyu and PhD student Xiong Jiao attended the annual meeting of the International Energy Transition Association.

In the Urban Construction Technology themed session, Dr. Yangsiyu Lu, assistant professor of CNCC trust at HKUST(GZ), was invited to be a guest speaker and share her latest research results on energy infrastructure transition.

item.title: Academic Seminar
item.description: Professor Pinghan Liang from the School of Government at Sun Yat-sen University was invited to give an academic lecture on the topic:Why is there so much surveillance in China? An Explanation from a Fiscal Perspective.

item.title: Academic Visiting
item.description:
Professor Yangsiyu Lu visited the University of Orleans and the Paris School of Economics from October 4th to 7th.

For more information,please visit the link.

item.title: CNCC Workshop
item.description: Prof. Yangsiyu Lu attended the Carbon Pricing and Climate Change in the Data-rich World Workshop held by CNCC Trust and gave an academic report titled “Raining on Bonds: The Financing Costs of Extreme Rain on Urban Investment Bonds”.

item.title: Global China Fellows Summit
item.description: Prof. Yangsiyu Lu was invited to attend the 2024 Globa China Fellows Summit and gave a policy round table speech from July 11 to 13.

item.title: China in the Global Economy - Kiel-Göttingen-CEPR Conference
item.description: Prof. Yangsiyu Lu was invited to attend the China in the Global Economy - Kiel-Göttingen-CEPR Conference and give a speech titled “Growing the Economy with Green Regulation: Evidence from Industrial Firm Productivity in China”.

item.title: The 7th International Workshop on Regional Air Quality Management in Rapidly Developing Economic Regions
item.description: Prof. Yangsiyu Lu was invited to attend the 7th International Workshop on Regional Air Quality Management in Rapidly Developing Economic Regions (7RAQM), served as the host of the sub-venue, and gave an academic report titled “Evidence from Environmental Regulation and Industrial Firm Productivity in China”

item.title: Academic Seminar
item.description: Professor Lu Yangsiyu was invited to give an academic report titled “Energy Infrastructure transition: carbon-intensive assets and investment patterns” at Divrsion of Public Policy in the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.
